author: @indiatoday
title: Telugu Hanuman Jayanti 2024: Date, puja timings wishes and quotes - India Today
text: Telugu Hanuman Jayanti 2024: Date, puja timings wishes and quotes Telugu Hanuman Jayanti will be celebrated on June 1, 2024, which is the tenth day of the dark fortnight in the month of Jyestha. This festival honours the birth of Lord Hanuman. It is mainly observed in the states of Andhra Pradesh and Telangana Listen to Story Telugu Hanuman Jayanti is a special festival celebrated to honor the birth anniversary of Lord Hanuman, a revered deity in Hinduism known for his strength, devotion, and loyalty. This festival is particularly significant in the Telugu-speaking states of Andhra Pradesh and Telangana. Date and Puja [Timings](https://www.indiatoday.in/information/story/telugu-hanuman-jayanthi-date-time-puja-and-significance-2544680-2024-05-28) This year, Telugu Hanuman Jayanti falls on Saturday, June 1, 2024. The auspicious Dashami Tithi (tenth lunar day) of Krishna Paksha (waning phase) in the Jyeshta month begins at - Dasami Tithi Begins - 07:24 AM on Jun 01, 2024 - Dasami Tithi Ends - 05:04 AM on Jun 02, 2024 This is the ideal time for pujas and rituals dedicated to Lord Hanuman. How is Telugu Hanuman Jayanti Celebrated? On this day, devotees perform various rituals and activities to show their devotion to Lord Hanuman, including: - Temple Visits: Many people visit Hanuman temples to offer prayers and seek blessings. - Fasting: Some devotees observe a fast to purify their mind and body. - Reading Scriptures: Devotees read sacred texts like the Hanuman Chalisa, Ramayana, and other scriptures that praise Lord Hanuman. - Offering Prasad: Special food offerings (prasad) are prepared and distributed among family, friends, and the needy. - Charity: Acts of charity and helping the less fortunate are common practices on this day. Wishes and Quotes for Telugu Hanuman Jayanti Sharing wishes and quotes is a heartfelt way to spread the joy and blessings of Telugu Hanuman Jayanti. Here are some thoughtful messages you can share with your loved ones: Wishes - "May Lord Hanuman bless you with strength, wisdom, and courage on this auspicious day. Happy Hanuman Jayanti!" - "Wishing you a joyous Hanuman Jayanti filled with devotion and happiness. Jai Hanuman!" - "May Hanuman Ji remove all obstacles from your life and grant you peace and prosperity. Happy Telugu Hanuman Jayanti!" Quotes - "Let us all chant the name of Bajrangbali and overcome all our troubles. Happy Hanuman Jayanti!" - "Lord Hanuman teaches us the true meaning of devotion and service. May his blessings be with you always." - "On this Hanuman Jayanti, may your heart be filled with devotion, and your life with happiness." Telugu Hanuman Jayanti is a day of deep devotion and celebration, honoring the mighty Lord Hanuman. By participating in the rituals, sharing wishes, and reflecting on his virtues, devotees seek to imbibe his qualities of strength, dedication, and unwavering faith. Whether you are observing this day through fasting, prayers, or charitable acts, may Hanuman Jayanti bring you peace and blessings.
